III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(i) Use of chemical agents including, but not limited to, pepper
spray, tear gas, and mace.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/25/23, staff member punched youth at the facility. There is
an incident report that reflects different information in which the
youth was assaultive towards the staff member and the staff
member blocked the assault.
Investigation This complaint was received on 01/31/2023 and was investigated
in collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 01/31/2023 and
reported no further information.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via phone on
01/31/2023. Foster Care Specialist reported Youth A has been
struggling in her placement because she does not like the facility.
She said Youth A told her that Staff 1 punched her in the face, but
Youth A did not report having any injuries. Foster Care Specialist
reported Youth A has a history of making false allegations against
previous licensed foster homes that were investigated and there
were no findings. She expressed no concerns regarding staff or
the facility.
I interviewed Youth A at the school on 02/01/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth A is 12 years old and has been at the
facility for five months. Youth A reported she does not like the
facility and wants to be moved. When asked about the allegations,
Youth A said that Staff 1 hit her in the face. Youth A said she was
trying to take a notepad from Staff 1 and that’s when she was hit
in the face. Youth A initially said Staff 1 hit her in the face with her
hand and then retracted said she was hit in the nose by Staff 1’s
elbow. Youth A said she does not know if Staff 1 punched or
accidentally elbowed her. Youth A denied being injured or hurt.
Youth A reported she has never been restrained at the facility.
Youth A said after the incident she AWOLed and was later picked
up by the police and returned to the facility.
I interviewed the Director at the facility on 02/01/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. The Director reported Youth A
2

has been struggling due to her behavior and has more than 50
incident reports since placement in October. After the incident on
1/25/23 Youth A AWOLed and was returned to the facility by law
enforcement. The Director reported that Youth A is very
aggressive and has assaulted every staff at the facility. She said
Youth A did not report being punched or hit by Staff 1. The
Director is meeting with the clinical team and Youth A’s foster care
specialist to discuss Youth A’s aggression and behavioral issues.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 02/01/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 has been working at the facility for
one year and completed all her CPI training. On 01/25/2023, She
was the only Youth Specialist in the building. Youth A was trying
to go into a restricted area to return a notepad. Staff 1 directed
Youth A that she cannot go to the office and asked Youth A to
give her the notepad. Youth A got mad and started to curse at
Staff 1. Youth A threw the notepad at Staff 1 and when Staff 1
caught the notepad, Youth A lashed out at Staff 1. Staff 1 put her
hands up to prevent Youth A from hitting her. Youth A grabbed
Staff 1’s wrist and Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s wrist to free herself
from Youth A’s hold. Youth A had scratched Staff 1’s hand. After
that Youth A ran outside and left without permission. She denied
hitting or punching Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 02/01/2023. Staff 2 did not
witness the incident. Staff 2 said Youth A is easily triggered and
violent toward staff when she is redirected. Staff 2 reported she
has never observed Staff 1 push or hit any youth. She said Staff 1
is very professional that she and other staff try to deescalate the
situations with Youth A by talking to her and removing the other
youths from the room.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 02/01/2023. Youth B has
been at the facility for 6 months. Youth B reported she witnessed
the incident involving Youth A and Staff 1 on 01/25/2023. She said
Youth A got mad, threw the notepad at Staff 1, ran up to Staff 1
and tried to hit Staff 1. Staff 1 put her hands up and tried to block
Youth A. Youth B said she tried to get Youth A to stop, but Staff 1
told her not to get involved. Youth B said Youth A then grabbed
her coat and left the facility. Youth B denied witnessing Staff 1 hit
Youth A. Youth B said she has never had any issues with any staff
members and has never been restrained. Youth B expressed no
concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Video Reviewed:
3

I reviewed video footage at the facility, on 02/01/2023, in
collaboration with the DHHS Specialist. The video date is
01/25/2022 at 3:50 pm in the hallway off the living room. Video
has no audio. Youth A and Staff 1 are seen interacting and Youth
A is holding a notepad. Youth A appears to be agitated and pacing
around Staff 1. Youth A throws the notepad at Staff 1, Staff 1
catches the notepad, and Youth A attempts to grab at Staff 1.
Staff 1 appears to be trying to block Youth A from hitting and
grabbing her. Youth A grabs Staff 1 wrist and Staff 1 grabs Youth
A’s wrist to release Youth A’s hold on her. Youth A is seen running
down the hallway. At no point in the video does Staff 1 hit, punch,
or push Youth A.
Contact was made with Van Buren Township Police Officer on
02/02/2023. He stated on 01/25/2023, when he picked up Youth A
she did not have or report any visible injuries.
A predisposition conference call held with DHHS Specialist on
02/17/2023 resulted in no findings.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident Report,01/25/2023, authored by Staff 1. Report was
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
• Staff 1’s employee file, No disciplinary action reports.
• Reviewed facility’s Behavior Management Policies and
Practices. While a wide variety of consequences may be used,
these are never to be excessively punitive or self-defeating. Staff
are trained in CPI and are to use block or deflect the weapon
when a youth hits them.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as the video evidence, and
staff and youth interviews, support that Staff 1 did not punch or hit
Youth A during the incident. Youth A has a history of making false
accusations per her Foster Care Specialist.
Consultation:
The facility was advised to remind staff when a youth is physically
combative to move away from the youth to avoid physical contact
and prevent a power struggle.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
